description.content: Weak foes that find strength and courage in numbers, fighting alongside their stronger allies.
Simple, hard-hitting melee fighter that attacks multiple foes at once.
Basic melee fighter, controls the flow of combat with deft strikes and slashes.
A fighter that pushes around characters and keeps them pinned and at armâ€™s length.
Straightforward, hard hitting foe that attacks with sweeping, heavy attacks.
Large foe that can hurl allies and enemies around.
Heavily armored foe that taunts opponents and can strike multiple opponents at once.
A reckless fighter that becomes more powerful when taking damage.
Foe that uses its reach and alert senses to defend an area.
Foe that uses its great strength to grapple or pin down its enemies.
Hard hitting foe that inflicts stun with a heavy blow.
A mobile ranged attacker that hits multiple times with a short bow or gun.
A skilled ranged attacker that hunts down and eliminates single targets.
A mobile melee fighter that is an excellent duelist.
A fighter that attacks in sweeping bursts.
A flying combatant that is more powerful against solitary foes.
A sneaky foe that hits hard against weakened foes.
A foe that becomes vastly more powerful when attacking from stealth. Can cross great distances instantly.
A fighter that uses bombs to disrupt the battlefield.
A holy warrior that can intervene and save nearby allies from harm.
Divinely infused foes with the power to shield allies from harm.
Martial leaders that are excellent at moving allies around.
A defensive expert that protects nearby allies with a powerful shield.
A fortune teller that relies on allies, fate, and the power of the stars to set up attacks.
A foe that draws upon the natural world to call forth overgrowth to hinder and harm their enemies.
A tough foe that protects allies with a portable shrine and martial arts.
A pacifistic foe that prefers to prevent any violence from happening at all.
A charismatic foe that can strongly empower a single ally with the power of their voice.
A fiery foe that hurls blasts that greatly harm grouped up enemies.
A foe that draws on earth aether to create terrain and smash enemies.
A foe that draws on water aether to summon a storm and deny a large area of the battlefield.
A foe that uses lightning aether to zip around the battlefield and harass enemies.
A foe that can inflict a high number of blights, enabling its allies.
A foe that relies on magnetic power to move around its enemies.
A foe that uses bursts of overwhelming power to focus down one enemy and deny them shelter.
A foe that throws out arcing blasts of energy.
A foe that uses chemical power to dissolve and disrupt enemy formations.
A strong artillery foe that punishes its enemies for keeping their distance.
A hard hitting, simple artillery foe that can do high damage every other turn if left alone.
A priest of the chambers. Their knowledge of titan lore is extensive and they are capable of channeling divine power through their voice alone.

Muscle-corded temple priests that are the ringers and guardians of the mighty bells of the Chambers, whose peal drives away evil creatures such as demons. These bells, though numerous, are holy objects, and their care and upkeep is a duty of the highest order.

Muscle-corded temple priests that are the ringers and guardians of the mighty bells of the Chambers, whose peal drives away evil creatures such as demons. These bells, though numerous, are holy objects, and their care and upkeep is a duty of the highest order.
Lightning-wielding relic hunters of the Chroniclers, who are sent out in search of dangerous artifacts to recover and imprison in the Chambers.
Thick hides and stony skin make these large beasts almost impossible to tell from boulders.
The enormous and foul-smelling Halitoad uses its long tongue to strangle and digest its prey.
Large omnivores that use their horns to tear up dungeon stones and get at the roots and insects within.
Part ape, part wolf, the Howler is a hyper aggressive monster with a bad temper.

Enormous beast found in overgrown dungeons. Its long tusks, thick and shaggy coat of hair, and sword-length claws make it a formidable opponent. Though fierce in appearance and quick to anger it spends most of its day sleeping and mostly forages for carrion, berries, and roots.

Birdlike beasts with pale faces and soothing voices, they use their resonant throat sacs to hypnotize prey and draw them closer. They often use these talents to hypnotize cabals of other monsters to protect their nests.

A dog-like beast with a fleshless, skull-like face. It feeds off carrion and is drawn to the aftermath of battles. Its body is so suffused with corrupted aether from the meat it feeds on that it can flicker ghost-like in and out of reality.
Swarms of bats, beetles, centipedes, or other carrion-eaters that have fed upon corpses in the deep ruins and become instilled with an uncanny hunger.
An equine monster with a forked, spiral horn, which it can use to channel ambient aether into deadly, reality bending bolts.

An enormous ruin beast resembling a cross between a hippopotamus and a massive, corpulent ape. It spends most of its day sleeping, and the rest eating. Though usually content to feed on trees and local dungeon flora, it is an incredibly strong hunter capable of insane bursts of speed and aggression, as creatures that disturb its rest are capable of finding out. Many adventurers have been shocked at the sight of one of these rotund giants tearing a demon in half.

trigger.content: If the Bonabra wakes up for any reason, it flies into an unstoppable rage.

description.content: A massive crab with a thorny shell that has adapted to life away from water. It burrows beneath loose soil in dungeons, where it mimics boulders.
A fish that uses its spiny body and an exuded slime to burrow through loose dirt or rock between stays in underground pools.

An airborne eel that uses sacs of buoyant liquid, which it can emit as a vapor, to propel itself around. It can inject this liquid into the bodies of its prey, causing them to float helplessly into the air, where it snatches them up.

This terrifying batlike creature uses its leathery wings to abduct and choke creatures with a soporific acid, taking them to its nest and storing them in pods made of bone meal and spit for later digestion.
The shuffling mass of relict servitors, in thrall to the network.
This mob is always present in Relict fights. When new husks are summoned, they add to the current mob, or create a new one that can act on the following round if there isnâ€™t one.
A pack of hunting beasts, such as molven, grox, or wolf lizards.

Natals are immature demons, smooth, pale-skinned humanoids. Wherever demons appears, breaching the veil between worlds, they inevitably pour forth. Given time, Natals warp, burst, and shed their skins, transforming into different and more powerful demons.

Spriggs are tiny nature spirits born from the essence of undergrowth and the small animals that live there, such as tiny birds or mice. They are extremely curious and playful, and often emerge from forests to follow after travelers for some distance in lines like wayward children. The aether of spriggs is so thin that it is almost impossible to harm them.

Archons are armored, tough warriors that can be used to represent particularly hardy fighters, military leaders, or warlords. Alternately, they can be used to represent particularly ruthless or tough monsters.
Rogues are quick witted and quick on their feet. They can be used to represent skilled thieves, scouts, or assassins, or particularly agile or bloodthirsty monsters.
A scion is invested with holy power, to protect its allies and punish its foes. It can be used to represent high priests, temple guardians, or monsters touched by some sort of divine power.
A crucible is a foe brimming with aetheric power, and could be used to represent a master wright, a war mage, or a monster that can draw upon magical forces or blasts of energy.
The Demolisher is pure strength and rage personified. It can be used to represent particularly colossal warriors, giants, or huge armored beasts.

trigger.content: The Demolisher begins combat in this phase, and enters Phase II when bloodied.
The Demolisher enters this phase when bloodied.

tactics.content: The Demolisher is a relatively straightforward fight. Characters will want to avoid colliding from its abilities, and finish it off quickly in phase II, where it becomes much stronger.

description.content: The Nocturnal relies on extreme mobility and fear to strike down its foes. It can be used to represent winged demons, master assassins gargoyles, or other vicious and mobile foes.

trigger.content: The Nocturnal begins combat in this phase, and enters Phase II at the end of the round.
The Nocturnal enters this phase at the end of the round while in Phase I, and enters Phase III at the end of the round.
The Nocturnal enters this phase at the end of the round while in Phase II, and enters Phase I at the end of the round.

tactics.content: The Nocturnal is an evasive and slippery legend fight that is the most scary when foes are split up. It can use its suite of abilities to force them to do so, or use Crippling Paranoia when it wants to really isolate someone.

description.content: This mob takes one turn a round, at the end of the round after all other characters have acted. The Minions mob is defeated if the Master is defeated.
The Master represents a monster that commands a legion of lesser minions, such as an enormous spider, a warlord, or a relict necromancer.

trigger.content: The Master begins combat in this phase, and enters Phase II at the start of round 4.
The Master enters this phase at the start of round 4.

tactics.content: The Master is a slightly more complicated basic legend that comes with its own (large) group of problems. Clearing out minions can make the fight more manageable, since many of the masterâ€™s abilities such as Assault Wave are less effective with less minions on the field.

description.content: A powerful and destructive being, such as a flying wyrm, an arch-wright, or an ancient demon.

trigger.content: The Razer begins combat in this phase, and enters Phase II at the end of the round.
The Razer has no special traits or abilities in this phase.
The Razer enters this phase at the end of the round while in Phase I, and enters Phase III at the end of the round.
The Razer enters this phase at the end of the round while in Phase II, and enters Phase I at the end of the round.

tactics.content: The Razor is a destructive tempo fight in which every third round it can throw a massive attack out. Characters will want to make sure to keep Rock Spires around or make their own cover, and spread out so that the Razer becomes unable to deal maximum damage with Elden Chaos.

description.content: Troopers armed with black powder bombs that pack a heavy payload.
Troopers armed with a belt-driven chain-sword. Very noisy and not particularly subtle.
Troopers armed with crude but heavy metal guns hammered together from scavenged Arkentech.
Higher rank soldiers armed with some of the latest to come out of the imperial forges. Using blast-packs to jump into combat, they swing about with heavy arkentech force maces.
Mercenary soldiers from across Arden Eld hired on for their love of combat or bloodshed. Extremely skilled and usually kept in reserve until their talents are needed.
